name.value: The Johns Hopkins Sleep Disorders Center

records.description: Treats conditions such as insomnia, sleep apnea, circadian rhythm disorders, narcolepsy, and restless leg syndrome.

forms.instructions_to_find:
1. Go to https://www.hopkinsmedicine.org/pulmonary/patient-care/sleep-medicine.html
2. Click the "Sleep Survey" link in the middle of the page
  * the "Sleep survey" link near the end of the page is an unrelated questionnaire

records.description: Offers state-of-the-art, comprehensive care for patients suffering from disorders including sleep apnea, restless legs syndrome, night terrors, snoring, insomnia and narcolepsy.

forms.instructions_to_find:
1. Go to https://www.northshore.org/sleep-center/
2. Click on "Patient Forms" in the left menu
3. Click on "Two Week Sleep Log"

records.booking_other: [Richard John Munson, M.D.](https://www.northshore.org/apps/findadoctor/physicians/richard-john-munson) specialises in sleep-related conditions
records.before_first: you may also be asked to fill out some of [their patient forms](https://www.northshore.org/sleep-center/patients/)
records.between_appointments: you may be referred for an outpatient sleep study at a [sleep lab](https://www.northshore.org/sleep-center/#sleep-center)

records.description: Provides a [Sleep Medicine Program](https://www.raleighneurology.com/specialties-services/sleep-medicine/) among many other services.

locations.name: Main office
locations.display_name: Raleigh Neurology Associates: Main office

locations.name: Durham office
locations.display_name: Raleigh Neurology Associates: Durham office

records.booking_other:
To get access to their telehealth site, contact them by phone and ask for a telehealth account.
When booking, you can ask to see your preferred doctor.  [Dr. Thomas Kirk, MD](https://www.raleighneurology.com/about-us/meet-our-physicians/thomas-kirk-md/) sees patients with any sleep concern, [Dr. Thomas Perkins, MD, PhD](https://www.raleighneurology.com/about-us/meet-our-physicians/thomas-perkins-md-phd/) specialises in circadian rhythm disorders, while [their other physicians](https://www.raleighneurology.com/about-us/meet-our-physicians/) have other specialisms.

records.before_first: you may be asked to fill out a sleep diary like [the one on their site](https://sleepsupportproject.org/sleep-diary-2/) (only available to members)

records.description: Provides care to patients who have a wide range of sleep-related disorders.

locations.name: Neurology Clinic
locations.display_name: UNC Sleep Disorders Center: Neurology Clinic

records.registration_other: a physician will refer you to [one of their doctors](https://www.med.unc.edu/neurology/divisions/sleep-1/sleep-team/).  You may be able to ask about [their e-consult service](https://www.med.unc.edu/neurology/new-patient-referrals-1/adult-referrals/adult-neurology-e-consults/) at this point
records.booking_other: they will call you (usually within about 14-21 days), and will schedule an appointment if necessary

records.description: A range of devices for tracking fitness and other statistics
records.procedure:
1. buy a Fitbit device
2. download the [Android app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.fitbit.FitbitMobile&hl=en_GB&gl=US) or [iOS app](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/fitbit-health-fitness/id462638897)
3. link your device with the app, so the device can upload reports through it
4. use the app or [the website's sleep page](https://www.fitbit.com/sleep)

records.description: A simple sleep tracker for Android phones.
records.procedure:
1. [download for Android](https://f-droid.org/en/packages/hu.vmiklos.plees_tracker/)
   * only available on [F-Droid](https://f-droid.org/), an alternative to the Play Store

records.description: An alarm clock and sleep cycle tracker for Android phones.
records.procedure:
1. [download trial version for Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.urbandroid.sleep&hl=en_GB&gl=US)
   * see [the limitations of the free version](https://docs.sleep.urbandroid.org/general/plan.html#free-sleep-as-android)
2. optionally [upgrade to the full version](https://docs.sleep.urbandroid.org/general/plan.html#full-sleep-as-android)

records.description: A free tool that generates sleep charts from CSV files.
records.procedure:
1. [go to the site](https://sleepcharter.z13.web.core.windows.net/)
2. upload CSV files for supported devices

records.description: The project this page belongs to.
records.procedure:
* [examine your diary through the dashboard](/dashboard)
* [read this documentation](/docs)
* [use the software library](/core)

events.value: each caffeinated drink includes coffee, tea, chocolate, cola
every time you take a sleeping pill or medication to aid sleep

reports.display_name: Sleep Diary Project: Report for doctors

records.description: A sleep logging application from the early 2000's.
records.procedure:
1. [download the zip file](http://www.supermemo.org/ftp/sleepchart.zip)
2. unzip it and run the program

records.description: A closed source Android application for tracking sleep habits.
records.procedure:
1. [download the APK](https://m.apkpure.com/sleepmeter-free/com.squalllinesoftware.android.applications.sleepmeter.free)
   * the app has to be installed manually, as it is no longer available on the Play Store

appointment_types.in-person: an appointment at a location above at an agreed time
appointment_types.by-voip: an appointment online in real-time (e.g. over Skype or Zoom)
appointment_types.by-email: an appointment online but not in real-time (e.g. e-mail or a web portal)
appointment_types.other: an appointment conducted some other way

outcomes.diagnose: the specialist will aim to diagnose the individual's condition
outcomes.treat: the specialist will aim to offer treatment
outcomes.refer: the specialist may refer the individual to a specialist for a rare condition
outcomes.explain: the specialist will explain relevant research outcomes when possible
outcomes.other: the specialist will produce some other outcome

procedure_type.researched: the "procedure" data has been researched by us (e.g. by reading the website)
procedure_type.confirmed: the "procedure" data has been confirmed by someone with direct experience (e.g. a doctor or patient)

referral_types.direct: a specialist who accepts referrals directly from members of the public
referral_types.secondary: a specialist who accepts referrals from any doctor (e.g. a general practitioner or primary care physician)
referral_types.tertiary: a specialist who accepts referrals from other sleep specialists

sharing_status.found online: can be found on the on the specialist's website
sharing_status.shared with consent: a blank example the specialist has consented to put online
sharing_status.private: a document containing personal information, or which the organisation has not yet made public

specialist_type.physician: a medical doctor who treats sleep disorders
specialist_type.researcher: an academic who studies sleep disorders

use_before_first.no: will not be used before the first appointment
use_before_first.maybe: may be used before the first appointment
use_before_first.yes: will be used before the first appointment

use_between_appointments.no: will not be used between appointments
